app module¶

app.py¶

The main flask app for userfront website.

class app.DateTimeEncoder(*, skipkeys=False, ensure_ascii=True, check_circular=True, allow_nan=True, sort_keys=False, indent=None, separators=None, default=None)¶

Bases: json.encoder.JSONEncoder

Encodes datetime into ISO format. :param obj: datetime :type obj: str

Returns

Date and time in ISO format.

default(obj)¶

Implement this method in a subclass such that it returns a serializable object for o, or calls the base implementation (to raise a TypeError).

For example, to support arbitrary iterators, you could implement default like this:

def default(self, o):
    try:
        iterable = iter(o)
    except TypeError:
        pass
    else:
        return list(iterable)
    # Let the base class default method raise the TypeError
    return JSONEncoder.default(self, o)
app.addEvent()¶

Add event to primary google calendar of current user

Returns

Result of adding event to calendar. Success or Error.

Return type

json

Event attributes sent in json data:

  • title {str} – title of the event

  • location {str} – location of event

  • desc {str} – description of event

  • startTime {str} – even start time in format date-time = full-date “T” full-time (eg. 2020-04-29T09:00:00-07:00)

  • endTime {str} – event end time. Similar formatting to start time

  • timeZone {str} – IANA timezone for event - defaults to Australia/Melbourne

redirect to google oauth2 redirect url.

Return type

Redirect

app.credentials_to_dict(credentials)¶

This function returns a python dictionary of few selected columns from credentials.

Parameters

credentials (flow.credentials) – The credentials returned from google_auth_oauthlib.flow

Returns

credential dictionary containing following keys: ‘token’,’refresh_token’,’token_uri’,’client_id’,’client_secret’, ‘scopes’

Return type

(dict)
